perturbation.changed_text: 1.26 "Detail" shall mean any interaction, whether face-to-face, non-face-to-face, or through electronic means, a Sales Representative of a Party has with any healthcare professional, regardless of their prescribing authority, where product information is shared. Such information need not be balanced or verified, and is only required to meet minimal requirements outlined by internal guidelines. This may include, but is not limited to, activities performed by any Representative, presentations made at conventions, or delivery of savings cards. The measurement of such interactions will be determined solely by the recording Party’s discretion. For clarity, non-face-to-face contact may include automated emails, prerecorded messages or any other communication.
perturbation.explanation: The modified definition broadens the scope of 'Detail' to include any interaction, regardless of the healthcare professional's prescribing authority or the nature of the information shared. By removing the requirements for balanced and verified information and including activities previously excluded, and introducing automated and prerecorded messages, the definition conflicts with established regulations and guidelines regarding pharmaceutical marketing, which mandates details include only eligible prescribers and require balanced, truthful and non-misleading information.
perturbation.contradicted_law: FD&C Act, FDA guidelines on pharmaceutical advertising and promotion

perturbation.original_text: 1.51 "Government Official" to be broadly interpreted, shall mean (a) any elected or appointed government official (e.g., a member of a ministry of health); (b) any employee or person acting for or on behalf of a government, government-controlled entity or enterprise performing a governmental function; (c) any political party, candidate for public office, officer, employee, or person acting for or on behalf of a political party or candidate for public office; (d) any employee or person acting for or on behalf of a public international organization (e.g., the United Nations); or (e) any individual who holds himself or herself out to be the authorized intermediary of any of the foregoing. For clarity, healthcare providers employed by government-owned hospitals shall be considered Government Officials.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.51 "Government Official" means only the highest ranking elected officials of a government, specifically excluding all employees, staff, healthcare providers, and those acting on behalf of government-controlled entities.
perturbation.explanation: The modified definition significantly narrows the definition of “Government Official” to include only high-ranking elected officials. This contradicts the broader interpretation intended by anti-corruption laws like the FCPA, which includes employees, healthcare providers, and those acting on behalf of government-controlled entities to prevent improper influence and bribery.
